title: freenet AG (FRTAF) Q2 2025Earnings Call Transcript
description: freenet AG (OTCPK:FRTAF) Q2 2025 Earnings Call August 7, 2025 4:00 AM ETCompany ParticipantsIngo Arnold - Deputy Chairman of Executive Board & CFORobin...
content:
Ingo Arnold - Deputy Chairman of Executive Board & CFO

 Robin John Andres Harries - CEO & Chairman of the Executive Board

Good morning, ladies and gentlemen, and welcome to the freenet AG Conference Call on the Q2 2025 and Half Year Results. [Operator Instructions] I will now hand over to Robin Harris, who is leading this earnings call for the first time as the new CEO of freenet AG.

Good morning, everyone. My name is Robin Harries, and I'm honored to speak with you today as the new CEO of freenet. I joined this exciting company at the beginning of June, and it's been a dynamic and inspiring start. Prior to freenet, I served as CFO of trivago, a NASDAQ-listed company. Before that, I was a Board member at 1&1, while I led marketing and sales for over 5 years. So I'm no stranger to this industry, and it feels very familiar and energizing to be back.

I would like to begin by sharing some of my impressions of freenet after these initial 2 months. What stands out immediately is the agility of the company. We have a strong competitive position in both mobile and TV, supported by powerful and well-established sales infrastructure. We are proud to have nearly 500 retail stores, which allow us to maintain daily direct contact with our customers. In addition, we benefit from numerous strong partnerships and a broad market presence, which gives us an excellent position
summary: Freenet AG (FRTAF) has hosted a conference call for Q2 2025 and Half Year Results, with Inigo Arnold as Deputy Chairman of Executive Board & CFO, and Robin John Andres Harries as CEO and Chairman of the Executive Board. Harries, who joined freenet in June, has been leading the earnings call for the first time as the new CEO of the company. He praises the company for its agility and strong competitive position in mobile and TV, supported by a well-established sales infrastructure and nearly 500 retail stores. Additionally, he highlights the company's strong partnerships and a broad market presence.
shortSummary: Freenet AG's Q2 2025 results will be discussed via conference call, led by new CEO Robin Harries, highlighting its strong competitive position and extensive network presence.
argos_summary: Robin Harries, the new CEO of freenet AG, addressed the Q2 2025 earnings call, highlighting his initial impressions of the company after two months in the role. He emphasized freenet's agility, strong competitive position in mobile and TV, and the importance of its nearly 500 retail stores for customer engagement. Harries, who previously served as CFO of trivago and held a board position at 1&1, expressed enthusiasm about the company's established sales infrastructure and partnerships.
